item.title: The Promise of Systems Medicine
item.description: What kinds of science are being done under this paradigm and how will it deliver a better future?

item.title: Gut Microbiome Diversity Visualization
item.description: A short workflow for generating alpha and beta diversity plots using taxonomic gut microbiome data from patients with autoimmune diseases.

item.title: A Simple Tidyverse Workflow
item.description: Exploratory data analysis with COVID-19 testing and prognosis in the US.

item.title: A Case for the Tidyverse
item.description: The tidyverse is a set of actively developed and well-maintained R packages to facilitate the typical data analysis workflow. Here’s why you should use it in your projects.

img { border-radius: 50%; width: 20em; } I’m Morgan, a third year computational medical science PhD student in the Forslund Lab at the Experimental and Clinical Research Center in Berlin, Germany. My academic background consists of a BSc in Pharmaceutical Sciences from Purdue University (2015) and a MSc in Systems Biology from Heidelberg University (2018). Though my curiosity to learn the inner workings of the human body has had the strongest influence on my professional decisions, I have nurtured a joy for programming since I first took Java in high school.

item.title: Resources
item.description: Here’s where I’ll eventually link to all the tagged/categorized resources I’ve used. Work by Megan Diddie.
